title: Shrimp Quesadillas Recipe
description: This shrimp quesadilla recipe with bell peppers, spicy shrimp, and melted Mexican cheese inside golden crispy tortillas is a real crowd-pleaser.

About Us The Allrecipes Allstars How to Add a Recipe GET THE MAGAZINE Latin American Mexican Main Dishes Quesadilla Recipes Shrimp Quesadillas 4.8 (149) 110 Reviews 31 Photos This recipe for spicy shrimp quesadillas features a fajita-style shrimp and bell pepper filling seasoned with cumin, chili powder, jalapeño, and lime. Serve warm with cilantro and sour cream. Submitted by DanaV Updated on May 1, 2024 Save Rate Print Share Close Add Photo 31 31 31 31 Prep Time: 20 mins Cook Time: 1 hr Total Time: 1 hr 20 mins Servings: 6 Jump to Nutrition Facts Cook Mode (Keep screen awake) Ingredients 1x 2x 4x Oops! Something went wrong. Our team is working on it. Original recipe (1X) yields 6 servings 2 tablespoons vegetable oil 1 onion, sliced 1 red bell pepper, sliced 1 green bell pepper, sliced 1 teaspoon salt 1 teaspoon ground cumin 1 teaspoon chili powder 1 pound uncooked medium shrimp, peeled and deveined 1 jalapeño pepper, seeded and minced 1 lime, juiced 1 teaspoon vegetable oil, or as needed 6 large flour tortillas 3 cups shredded Mexican cheese blend, divided Directions Heat 2 tablespoons oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Add onion and bell peppers; cook, stirring frequently, until onion is translucent and peppers are soft, 6 to 8 minutes. Add salt, cumin, and chili powder; stir to coat vegetables. Add shrimp; cook and stir until shrimp are opaque and no longer pink in the center, 3 to 5 minutes. Remove from the heat and stir in minced jalapeño and lime juice. Heat another skillet over medium heat and brush with about 1 teaspoon oil. Place one tortilla in the hot skillet; spoon about 1/6 of the shrimp filling and 1/2 cup Mexican cheese blend onto one side of tortilla. Fold tortilla in half. Cook until lightly browned on the bottom, about 5 minutes. Flip and cook until lightly browned on the other side, 3 to 5 minutes. Repeat to make remaining quesadillas. I Made It Print 296 home cooks made it! Add Your Photo Photos of Shrimp Quesadillas 01 of 31 Photo by  naples34102 02 of 31 Photo by  Kiki 05/05/2024 This was delicious, not too spicy so next time will add more spices... I followed almost... No red peppers or salsa and I added old bay... Did make with black beans and Mexican rice(not pictured on my plate) 03 of 31 Photo by  Jeannine Houck 04/09/2021 I was out of so many of the ingredients but the basic recipe got me to a delicious meal. Lemon instead of lime, extra jalapeño and added mushrooms. I also had to substitute saffron for the cumin, delicious! 04 of 31 Photo by  dknight0909 08/30/2020 05 of 31 Photo by  Monica M Cisneros 05/10/2020 These were so good. I added some minced garlic with the bell pepper and onion. Other than that, no alterations. 06 of 31 Photo by  rico46 08/08/2019 07 of 31 Photo by  Imani 08/05/2019 08 of 31 Photo by  Christine Wells 06/04/2019 I don’t like onions so skipped that. I needed a filler so added rice. A yummy quick and easy dinner . Added lettuce and greens with sour cream 09 of 31 Photo by  DGSince 05/01/2019 10 of 31 Photo by  Bill 04/14/2019 1 2 3 4 Next You’ll Also Love Shrimp Tacos with Cilantro-Lime Crema 59 Ratings Black Bean and Corn Quesadillas 1,953 Ratings Easy Quesadillas 43 Ratings Grilled Fish Tacos with Chipotle-Lime Dressing 1,118 Ratings 2-Minute Cheese Quesadillas 38 Ratings Mexican Pizza 636 Ratings Cilantro Shrimp Tacos 15 Ratings Tangy Tuna Black Bean Quesadillas 72 Ratings Deviled Shrimp Tostadas 1 Rating Grilled Spicy Shrimp Tacos 14 Ratings Chicken Quesadillas 1,196 Ratings Vegan Black Bean Quesadillas 91 Ratings Jalapeño Cream Cheese Chicken Enchiladas 566 Ratings Cyndi's Shrimp Fajitas 99 Ratings Hawaiian Pizza Quesadillas 4 Ratings Chicken Enchiladas with Creamy Green Chile Sauce 410 Ratings Allrecipes Newsletters Follow Us Dinners Meals Ingredients Occasions Cuisines Kitchen Tips News Features About Us Editorial Process Privacy Policy Product Vetting Terms of Service Advertise Careers Contact Your Privacy Choices   Allrecipes is part of the Dotdash Meredith publishing family. name: DanaV
instructions: Heat 2 tablespoons oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Add onion and bell peppers; cook, stirring frequently, until onion is translucent and peppers are soft, 6 to 8 minutes. Add salt, cumin, and chili powder; stir to coat vegetables.;Add shrimp; cook and stir until shrimp are opaque and no longer pink in the center, 3 to 5 minutes. Remove from the heat and stir in minced jalapeño and lime juice.;Heat another skillet over medium heat and brush with about 1 teaspoon oil. Place one tortilla in the hot skillet; spoon about 1/6 of the shrimp filling and 1/2 cup Mexican cheese blend onto one side of tortilla. Fold tortilla in half. Cook until lightly browned on the bottom, about 5 minutes. Flip and cook until lightly browned on the other side, 3 to 5 minutes. Repeat to make remaining quesadillas.
